Definition: The matrix is comprised of 3 dimensions/categories:Economic, Social & Environmental. These are the main umbrellas on which the assessment is based.
A dimension can be expressed by using a number of criteria or pillars. Each dimension is divided into 2-4 pillars.
The indicators are selected to assess the impact of the pillars. They are used to measure change in each dimension.
Type of data used for each indicator (i.e. qualitative, quantitative, or both)
How the indicator data is presented (e.g. pie chart, timeline)
The source/s where each indicator's data will be acquired from
Any comments regarding the indicator, data visualisation, data acquisition or the sources
Achieving high, sustainable, and inclusive economic growth through a competitive, diversified, and knowledge-based economy that generates productive jobs and rising incomes.
Promoting social justice, inclusion, and empowerment for all Egyptians through quality healthcare, education, culture, and protection for vulnerable groups.
Integrating environmental sustainability across all sectors to efficiently preserve natural resources, mitigate pollution and climate risks, and promote sustainable development.
Includes the following pillars: Economic Development, Energy, Knowledge, innovation & scientific research, and Transparency & efficient government institutions.
Includes the following pillars: Social Justice, Health, Education & Training, and culture
Includes the following pillars: Environment, and Urban Development
